data.question: What is the main benefit of using the mobile app within the launch pad?
answers: Consolidation of communication channels

data.question: What is the purpose of the GMB integration in the Launch Pad?
answers: To capture phone numbers and recordings generated from a google Listing
To instantly engage with customer inquiries using Google search (on mobile)
To generate and provide exposure to customer reviews

data.question: What is the purpose of the Stripe connection in the Launch Pad?
answers: To integrate a payment processor for use with invoices, payment links, websites, funnels, and products.

data.question: When would you use a number pool? (Multiple Choice - Select ALL that apply)
answers: To identify the best-performing channels
To track phone numbers across different campaigns

data.question: Where can you access the phone numbers section in the app?
answers: In the sub-account settings

data.question: What is the purpose of integrating a phone provider within the agency settings?
answers: To allow sub-accounts users to easily purchase and utilize all the phone features within the CRM (SMS, Calling, Recording, & Voicemail drops)

data.question: What is the benefit of using the missed call text back feature?
answers: It automatically sends a custom or default text message to missed callers.

data.question: Where can you access the system's missed call text back feature?
answers: Business profile settings

data.question: Is a phone provider necessary to test the missed call text back feature?
answers: Yes, a phone provider needs to be set up for proper testing.

data.question: What is the biggest advantage of using High Level's web-chat widgets over traditional ones?
answers: It allows for two-way conversations through SMS.

data.question: Why is SMS considered beneficial for web chat engagement?
answers: It ensures higher response rates.

data.question: How can the chat widget be added to specific pages within a funnel or website?
answers: By individually editing each page's settings and adding the widget's code.

data.question: Which tab should you navigate to create a workflow for the web chat widget?
answers: Automations

data.question: What trigger should you select for the workflow for web chat widget?
answers: Customer replied

data.question: What information can be passed on to the user in the notification?
answers: Name
Mobile Number
Message
Email

data.question: What 'action' in the workflow allows you to send an information to a user?
answers: Internal Notification

data.question: When using the internal notification, which pages can be specified for the redirect when a user clicks on a the app notification?
answers: Contact record
Conversations view
Opportunity Page

data.question: How can you access additional payment gateways like NMI and authorized.net?
answers: Within the Payments section and Integrations tab located in the sub-account settings

data.question: Which integration allows you to enable Google & Apple Pay?
answers: Stripe Connect

data.question: What does the Google account integration in the settings allow you to do?
answers: Access Google Analytics, Google My Business data, and calendar sync integration

data.question: What is the purpose of the QuickBooks integration?
answers: To send review links to paid invoices

data.question: Where can you submit ideas for platform and integration improvements?
answers: At ideas.gohighlevel.com

data.question: What are the two types of audit logs mentioned in the video?
answers: Agency audit logs and Sub-account audit logs

data.question: Where can you find the audit logs in the system?
answers: Within the Sub-Account Settings

data.question: How far back in time can you view the audit logs?
answers: Up to 60 days

data.question: Is it possible to restore deleted items using the audit logs?
answers: Yes, it depends on the action and its limitations.

data.question: Where can you access the template library in the app?
answers: Blogs
Website Builder
Email Builder
Social Planner

data.question: How can the template library be enabled for sub accounts?
answers: It can be enabled in the Agency Settings.

data.question: What difference is there between an agency user and a sub account user when importing a template?
answers: The agency user sees a GoHighLevel warning notice while the sub account user sees the agency's name.

data.question: How can you check if a user is a sub account user?
answers: Check the user's profile in the app within the settings > staff tab

data.question: What is the difference between a custom value and a custom field?
answers: Custom values are global fields, while custom fields are contact dependent.

data.question: Can custom values be different for each contact or lead?
answers: No, custom values are the same for all contacts and leads.

data.question: How can custom values be utilized in marketing campaigns?
answers: To dynamically insert standardized information across campaign assets/ collateral.

data.question: What does the 'Enable Email Signatures' option allow users to do?
answers: Append an email signature to all outgoing messages
Include the signature before quoted text in replies
Add an image to the email signature

data.question: Where can you enable/disable the visibility of the Dashboard Stats for the user?
answers: User permissions

data.question: Which role has the permission to create new sub-accounts?
answers: Admin

data.question: When would you typically need to reassign leads from one user to another?
answers: When a user departs from the sub-account

data.question: What is the primary purpose of creating a workflow to move leads?
answers: To facilitate bulk lead assignment between users and ensure that no leads fall through the cracks.

data.question: What must be done before removing a user from the sub-account?
answers: Reassign the leads from that user to another user

data.question: What is the purpose of marking messages as 'unread'? (Via workflows or manually)
answers: To highlight important messages

data.question: How can contacts be marked as 'starred'?
answers: By clicking the star icon in the conversation thread

data.question: What caution is given about deleting conversation threads?
answers: Deleted threads cannot be recovered

data.question: What feature allows users to access detailed contact information from the Conversations tab?
answers: Clicking on the contact's name or card

data.question: What is the main purpose of using SMS and email templates in the system?
answers: To ensure consistent messaging from user across interactions

data.question: What is the purpose of adding custom values to templates?
answers: To efficiently update message information across the system where the template is utilized.

data.question: When sending SMS messages, what happens if the character count exceeds a certain threshold?
answers: The message will be sent in multiple segments (separate messages)

data.question: To bring in human touch points when necessary
answers: To bring in human touch points when necessary
Time-sensitive tasks
Approval processes

data.question: Which of the following is NOT a requirement for manual call and SMS actions to work?
answers: Being on a specific subscription plan

data.question: How can you handle different outcomes from manual call actions?
answers: Use branching to create separate actions for different outcomes

data.question: Which parameter determines how soon an appointment can be scheduled?
answers: Minimum scheduling notice

data.question: What is the benefit of assigning leads to specific agents in a round-robin calendar?
answers: It avoids duplicate bookings.
It automatically distributes leads based on the calendar settings.
It ensures that leads get the time they want or allows them to select the staff member of their choice.

data.question: What are the two types of scheduling/share links that are provided for a calendar? (3 Dot dropdown options)
answers: Permanent and Scheduling link

data.question: What is the primary purpose of assigning a specific calendar link to a user?
answers: To ensure that the lead receives a link to the user's calendar to whom they are assigned.

data.question: How can a sales agent's/ Users calendar link be included in a outbound message?
answers: By adding in the message body

data.question: What should be considered when using automation to send user-specific calendar links?
answers: Leads must be assigned to the correct sales agent (user)

data.question: What happens if a lead is not properly assigned to a sales agent (user) when using automation with user-specific calendar links?
answers: The lead will not receive any calendar link. The message body where the link is will be blank.

data.question: What is the primary purpose of setting up triggers for different calendar types?
answers: To automate messaging and appointment-related actions, by ensuring that the trigger only fires when it should.

data.question: What is the significance of specifying 'recurring event type' as a trigger filter within a workflow?
answers: It ensures the trigger is fired only for recurring appointments

data.question: What is the essential requirement for the 'confirmed' appointment status trigger?
answers: It ensures the system looks for a specific 'status' in the appointment trigger

data.question: How can 'non-confirmed' appointments statuses trigger/fire a workflow?
answers: By using the 'new' status filter for the 'appointment status trigger.'

data.question: What is the purpose of the 'Calendars and Appointments' tab?
answers: To provide a way to see each users calenders and appointments
To show a daily, weekly or monthly overview of appointments and calendars
To display daily appointments only
To highlight past appointments

data.question: How can you integrate your calendar into the system?
answers: By connecting your Google and or Outlook calendar

data.question: What does an appointment marked as 'unconfirmed' mean?
answers: It requires manual confirmation by the user

data.question: What is one of the prerequisites mentioned for using appointment booking features?
answers: Creating a calendar widget and workflows for reminders

data.question: How can users book an appointment on behalf of a contact from within a conversation?
answers: By clicking the 'Book Appointment' button in the conversation preview or within the appointment tab

data.question: How can appointment status triggers be utilized in automation workflows?
answers: To initiate follow-up actions based on appointment status changes

data.question: How can you change the starting day of the week on your calendar?
answers: Through account calendar preferences

data.question: Which meeting link option may not show up if it hasn't been integrated with the user's profile?
answers: Zoom & Google Meet

data.question: What's the difference between calendar availability and user availability?
answers: Calendar availability reflects the business's start time and day of the week, while user availability specifies the user's working hours.

data.question: How does user availability impact appointment bookings?
answers: It influences which team member's availability is considered when a lead books.

data.question: Why is the first row of a CSV file important?
answers: It must not be blank

data.question: What are the contact requirements need for the system to link data back to the contact?
answers: An email or phone number

data.question: Which field type has case-sensitive and spelling-sensitive requirements?
answers: Radio button

data.question: Why is cleaning a CSV file important before uploading?
answers: To prevent sending duplicate SMS
To avoid duplicate messaging
To improve contact organization

data.question: What is the suggested approach to identifying duplicate values?
answers: Highlight columns with conditional formatting

data.question: If not corrected, how are duplicate records typically handled when uploading the file?
answers: The first duplicate is kept

data.question: Why is the 'Remove Duplicates' function in Excel not recommended?
answers: It removes entire contact records

data.question: Who can access the 'Import Contacts' feature?
answers: Location admin

data.question: What is the purpose of using the 'None' option for unique identifiers?
answers: To generate unique contact IDs for each row

data.question: In the mapping view (before importing list), how are unmatched fields handled?
answers: They can be manually mapped (custom fields) or skipped

data.question: When might you enable the 'Allow Duplicate Contacts' setting?
answers: When importing contacts with shared email/phone numbers

data.question: What is the benefit of using contact IDs as identifiers during import?
answers: It helps create records for contacts using the contact ID instead of relying solely on email and phone numbers as the unique identifiers.

data.question: What is one reason for exporting contacts and custom fields?
answers: To perform data analysis in Excel

data.question: Which of the following fields are included in the default export?
answers: Name, email, phone B
Create date, last activity
Tags

data.question: How can additional custom fields be included in an export?
answers: By selecting them in the 'columns' menu

data.question: How can you choose specific contacts for export?
answers: By selecting based on parameters set in your smartlist or manually checking the box next to the contacts name

data.question: What is the primary purpose of smart lists?
answers: To segment leads/contacts based on specific criteria.

data.question: In filtering, what is the function of 'and' conditions?
answers: To combine multiple filters and find leads that meet all conditions.

data.question: What is the purpose of the 'is not' filter option?
answers: To exclude leads that meet a specific condition.

data.question: How can smart lists be shared with other users?
answers: By granting access to users within the 'Manage smart list' area.

data.question: What is the primary purpose of the Company Object feature in the CRM?
answers: To facilitate communication within organizations

data.question: What is the significance of the 'Company Object' feature when dealing with
answers: It centralizes all contacts into a single company entity.

data.question: What is the purpose of creating custom fields in the CRM?
answers: To store specific information about contacts

data.question: What is the purpose of creating and managing tasks within the system?
answers: To remind individuals to complete specific actions.

data.question: Which of the following statements about task assignment is correct?
answers: Tasks can be assigned to users, regardless of their connection to contacts.

data.question: What is the purpose of using internal notifications for task reminders?
answers: To remind users about upcoming tasks.
